issue.description:
justification_support_item does not include properties. It should include: Activity_property Assigned_property
Mappings and MIM to be extended to match.
Cannot state the type of person and other requirements for a position or position_type. Suggest extending tsr_required_resource_item to include position and position_type.
Need to extend state_definition_of_item select type to include Activity_method and Applied_activity_method_assignment.
Need to add to tsr_documented_element_select to include Activity_property to allow, for exmaple, the source document for a property to be recorded.

The select condition_item contains: Task_assignment Task_method_relationship Task_relationship
Surely condition_evaluation_item should contain something to do with TASK?
The module should use from condition_evaluation.
As this is the first point at which ap239_product_definition_information gets brought in, condition_evaluation_item should also contain activity_property.

Need to extend type_of_person select to include person. This is to make it possible to assert that a person is of a given type. Note that it is possible here but maybe could be done elsewhere (such as in the type_of_person module?).

Probably better to specify Applied_activity_method_assignment here rather than Task_assignment. This opens up properties in the cases where Activity_method is being used in a general way - as a type of Activity as well as when it is a Task or Scheme.
Need to be able to extend identification to Type_of_person, Qualification, Type_of_expereince and Position_in_organisation.

It should be possible to have an Activity_property and Activity_property_representation as parameters to a condition. Extend the condition_evaluation_parameter_item and condition_parameter_item selects accordingly.
Add the characterization of Activity_property and Resource_property entities. Should include i.e. classification_assignment (See ap_239_properties).
It should be possible to assign a state_definition to a Task.
